business.name: Little Stars
business.target_users: Children with ADHD ages 3-18, their families, therapists, doctors

monthly_revenue.note: App recently published on Play Store and Apple Store, not monetizing yet

bloom_program.label: very_positive_grateful
evidence: Program was very good - grant, support from trainer and mentor
Loved group sessions, learning from other entrepreneurs
Created community, know people like Riad from Batroun
Appreciated courses on finance, digital marketing, MVP, go-to-market strategy

mentor_hasam_relationship.label: highly_valuable_responsive
evidence: Hasam helped define focus: ONE thing at a time
Corrected survey design for ADHD vs general users
Gave specific actionable feedback on PowerPoint presentations

app_development_progress.label: proud_accomplished
evidence: Built dashboard for admin (users, payments, freelancers, profiles)
Published on Play Store and Apple Store

adhd_stigma_awareness.label: mission_driven_reducing_stigma
evidence: Origin story: Sara (referenced child) struggled, finally diagnosed
Goal: 'so no child with ADHD feels alone again'
People don't reveal ADHD until Clara explains the app, then they open up

partnerships_urgency.label: need_help_referrals
evidence: Reached stage where partnerships are critical
Working with therapy centers for testing

explicit_needs.evidence: I've reached the partnership stage. Partnerships are very important. I need someone to refer me to potential partners so I can talk to them about the application for schools
Need referrals to schools to present the app

implied_needs.inference: App is live but no revenue mentioned. Promo codes system exists. Seeking $20K for finalization + marketing. Needs revenue model clarity
Surveys done: 19 parents, 14 teachers. Small sample. Needs larger validation before major school partnerships
Mentioned partnerships with educational toys, brands. Promo codes like 'you are bright', 'brilliant'. Creative monetization angle
Mentioned needing HR to verify CVs of freelancers and therapists. Quality control concern

core_values.evidence: So no child with ADHD feels alone again. When I explain the app, people reveal they have ADHD too - they didn't share before
App connects children → families → therapists → doctors. Not just tools, but community
Valued feedback from market, mentor corrections, survey-driven development
Last thing: we work as a team. Not one person doing everything alone. We work as a team for this project to succeed

interest_level.note: Cooperative model not explicitly discussed in this interview
interest_level.inference: Very likely interested - strong team orientation, values community (Bloom community important to her)

most_valuable: Focused guidance (one thing at a time)

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong values alignment (teamwork, mission-driven, feedback-oriented). MVP launched = action-oriented. BUT: Pre-revenue, small validation sample, needs partnerships to scale. Good pilot candidate for sector diversity (special needs EdTech) and strong team mentality. Risk: early stage monetization uncertainty.

recommendation.unique_value: Special needs EdTech representation, strong team mentality, reducing stigma mission

specific_opportunities.description: Clara needs school introductions. Bloom network likely has connections to schools (parents, educators, administrators) from 1,046 teams
specific_opportunities.action_required: Bilal searches Bloom database for: (1) EdTech companies working with schools, (2) Founders who are educators/parents, (3) School administrators in network

specific_opportunities.description: Clara mentioned: 'When we see ADHD memes...' - suggests she's in ADHD online communities. Could leverage for growth

strategy.opportunity: Active content creator - ADHD-positive memes, parenting tips, de-stigmatization

specific_opportunities.action_required: Marketing strategy session: ADHD community engagement + content plan

specific_opportunities.description: Clara mentioned partnerships with educational toys + promo codes ('you are bright', 'brilliant'). Smart monetization angle

model.example_brands: Fidget toys, sensory products, learning games

specific_opportunities.action_required: Business model workshop: affiliate partnerships + brand sponsorships strategy

strengths: Holistic ecosystem thinking (kids + families + therapists + doctors)
growth_edges: Market validation scale (33 surveys → need hundreds)
B2B sales skills (schools are different from consumers)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: Special needs EdTech focus, de-stigmatization mission, Arab/Lebanese ADHD community advocacy
